result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Petrella Faye Murphy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Petrella Faye Murphy in court.  Attorney Erica N Young in court for Petrella Faye Murphy.  Attorney Sam Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel has received discovery and will receive an offer and requests additional time to review. Case may be on a DPA track.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense counsel contacted the Court requesting an adjournment. Case adjourned off the record. Case remains calendared in Br 13. Parties advised of the new date.

Defendant Petrella Faye Murphy in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not contacted the SPD office to see if she qualifies for representation.  Court instructed defendant to go over to the SPD office after today's hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Petrella Faye Murphy in court without counsel.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Petrella Faye Murphy appeared by video means. Defendant has not obtained counsel at this time.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Petrella Faye Murphy in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/18/2022@1:30pm
